name.text: 10.0.17 (Example of finding gradient at particular point)

questiontext.text:
Example

Find the gradient of the tangent to the curve \(f(x)= x^2\) at the point \((2,4)\).

Solution

We will use the observation above, so let \(A\) be the point \((2,4)\) and \(B\) be the point \(2+h, f(2+h)\) = \((2+h, (2+h)^2)\). Thus the gradient of the tangent at the point A is \[ \begin{align*} \mbox{gradient } &= \lim\limits_{h \to 0} \frac{f(2+h) -f(2)}{h} \\ &= \lim\limits_{h \to 0} \frac{(2+h)^2 -4}{h} \\ &= \lim\limits_{h \to 0} \frac{4 +4h +h^2 - 4}{h} \\ &= \lim\limits_{h \to 0} \frac{h(4+h)}{h} \\ &= \lim\limits_{h \to 0} 4 + h \:\:\:\:\: \mbox{as } h \ne 0 \\ &= 4 \end{align*} \]
